data.text:
Question:

Setting:

The setting for a narrative work refers to the places and time in which the story occurs. Often, different scenes of a tale or parts of a novel will be set in different locations in space while a few works may set scenes at different times. The setting of a story helps to define the actions that are possible while explaining some of the characters' behavior from the viewpoint of a culture at that point in time.

Answer and Explanation:
